data.enText: move upwards
to lift or move sth to a higher level
She raised the gun and fired.
He raised a hand in greeting.

data.chText: 她停下工作，抬起头看了看。
data.enText: She raised her eyes from her work.
to move sth/sb/yourself to a vertical position

data.chText: 不管怎样，我们终于让她站了起来。
data.enText: Somehow we managed to raise her to her feet.

data.chText: 他用一只胳膊肘支起身子。
data.enText: He raised himself up on one elbow.
increase
to increase the amount or level of sth

data.chText: 提高薪水 / 价格 / 税金
data.enText: to raise salaries/prices/taxes
They raised their offer to $500.

data.chText: 我们怎样才能提高学校的水平？
data.enText: How can we raise standards in schools?

data.chText: 没确定之前别告诉她工作的事——我们不想让她期望过高。
data.enText: Don't tell her about the job until you know for sure─we don't want to raise her hopes (= make her hope too much) .

data.chText: 我甚至从没听到他提高过嗓门儿。
data.enText: I've never heard him even raise his voice (= speak louder because he was angry) .
collect money/people
to bring or collect money or people together; to manage to get or form sth
to raise a loan
We are raising money for charity.
He set about raising an army .
mention subject
to mention sth for people to discuss or sb to deal with

data.chText: 这本书提出了许多重要问题。
data.enText: The book raises many important questions .
I'm glad you raised the subject of money.
cause
to cause or produce sth; to make sth appear
to raise doubts in people's minds

data.chText: 新的开发计划惹得当地居民愤怒抗议。
data.enText: The plans for the new development have raised angry protests from local residents.

data.chText: 虽然这些观众很难逗乐，但他的笑话还是引起了一阵笑声。
data.enText: It wasn't an easy audience but he raised a laugh with his joke.

data.chText: 尽管这一天很不顺利，但她还是努力露出笑容。
data.enText: It had been a difficult day but she managed to raise a smile.

data.chText: 马蹄翻飞，扬起一片尘土。
data.enText: The horses' hooves raised a cloud of dust.
child/animal
to care for a child or young animal until it is able to take care of itself

data.chText: 他们俩都是在南方长大的。
data.enText: They were both raised in the South.
kids raised on a diet of hamburgers

data.chText: 他们让她从小就信天主教。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: They raised her (as) a Catholic.

data.chText: 我是个在都市里出生长大的男孩子。
data.enText: I was born and raised a city boy.
farm animals/crops
to breed particular farm animals; to grow particular crops
to raise cattle/corn
end sth
to end a restriction on sb/sth

data.chText: 解除封锁 / 禁令 / 禁运 / 包围
data.enText: to raise a blockade/a ban/an embargo/a siege
on radio/phone

data.chText: （通过无线电或电话）与…取得联系，和…通话
data.enText: to contact sb and speak to them by radio or telephone

data.chText: 我们打他的移动电话，总算找到了他。
data.enText: We managed to raise him on his mobile phone.
dead person
to make sb who has died come to life again

data.chText: 基督教徒相信上帝让耶稣死而复生。
data.enText: Christians believe that God raised Jesus from the dead.
in card games

data.chText: 在（另一玩牌人）基础上加注

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: to make a higher bet than another player in a card game
I'll raise you another hundred dollars.
mathematics
to multiply an amount by itself a particular number of times
3 raised to the power of 3 is 27 (= 3 × 3 × 3) .
raise a/your hand against/to sb
to hit or threaten to hit sb
raise your eyebrows (at sth)

data.chText: 扬起眉毛（表示不赞同或惊讶）
data.enText: to show that you disapprove of or are surprised by sth

data.chText: 他没有和妻子一起来，大家都很惊讶。
data.enText: Eyebrows were raised when he arrived without his wife.
raise your glass (to sb)
to hold up your glass and wish sb happiness, good luck, etc. before you drink
raise hell

data.chText: 愤怒抗议；（尤指）大吵大闹
data.enText: to protest angrily, especially in a way that causes trouble for sb
raise the roof
to produce or make sb produce a lot of noise in a building, for example by shouting or cheering
raise sb's spirits
to make sb feel more cheerful or brave
raise/up the ante
to increase the level of sth, especially demands or sums of money
make sb's hackles rise
raise sb's hackles
to make sb angry
raise/lower your sights

data.chText: 提高 / 降低要求；眼光变高 / 变低
data.enText: to expect more/less from a situation
raise/lower the temperature

data.chText: 升 / 降温；增加 / 减少热烈程度等
data.enText: to increase/decrease the amount of excitement, emotion, etc. in a situation

data.chText: 他愤然拒不同意，使得会议的气氛紧张起来。
data.enText: His angry refusal to agree raised the temperature of the meeting.
raise sth to sb/sth
to build or place a statue, etc. somewhere in honour or memory of sb/sth

data.chText: 这座小镇为战争中牺牲的人树立了一座纪念碑。
data.enText: The town raised a memorial to those killed in the war.
Verbs

data.chText: 动词raise后必须接宾语，而rise不接宾语。raise表示举起、提起、提升、增加：
data.enText: Raise is a verb that must have an object and rise is used without an object. When you raise something, you lift it to a higher position or increase it.
He raised his head from the pillow.
We were forced to raise the price.

data.chText: 表示人或物从低处向高处上升用rise：
data.enText: When people or things rise , they move from a lower to a higher position.
She rose from the chair.
The helicopter rose into the air.

data.chText: rise亦表示数字上升或数量增加：
data.enText: Rise can also mean ‘to increase in number or quantity’.
Costs are always rising.
Nouns

data.chText: 名词rise表示上升、升起、（数量的）增加：
data.enText: The noun rise means a movement upwards or an increase in an amount or quantity.
a rise in interest rates

data.chText: 在英国英语中亦可指工资的增加：
data.enText: In BrE it can also be used to mean an increase in pay.

data.chText: 我应要求老板增加工资吗？
data.enText: Should I ask my boss for a rise?

data.chText: 在北美英语中此义用raise表示：
data.enText: In NAmE this is a raise .
a three per cent pay raise
Rise can also mean the process of becoming more powerful or important.
his dramatic rise to power

means: 在（另一玩牌人）基础上加注

ex.chText: 他抬了一下帽子，然后走开了。
ex.enText: He raised his hat and walked away.

ex.chText: 我们要尽全力提高人民的生活水平。
ex.enText: We must do our best to raise people's living standards.

ex.chText: 所得税提高3%，就会有钱了。
ex.enText: The money could be found by raising income tax by three per cent.

ex.chText: 最近猪肉提价了。
ex.enText: The price of pork has been raised recently.

synonyms.bx: 及物动词，主语通常为人、机构等，既指抬起或举起具体事物，也指提高数量、水平、价格、质量等，常包含人为因素。

ex.chText: 太阳从东方升起。
ex.enText: The sun rises in the east.

ex.chText: 什么原因造成海平面上升？
ex.enText: What causes the sea level to rise?

ex.chText: 转过几个弯之后，这条路突然变陡。
ex.enText: The road rises steeply after several turns.

ex.chText: 最近猪肉提价了。
ex.enText: The price of pork has risen recently.

ex.chText: 他升到了经理职位。
ex.enText: He rose to the position of manager.

synonyms.bx: 不及物动词，主语通常为事物，既指水位、地势等升高，也指数量、价值、地位等提高，通常不包含人为因素。

ex.chText: 吊车把集装箱吊运到卡车上。
ex.enText: The crane lifted the container onto the truck.

ex.chText: 她揭开汤锅的盖子加了些盐。
ex.enText: She lifted the lid on the pot of soup to add some salt.

ex.chText: 这块石头太重了，我搬不起来。
ex.enText: The stone is too heavy for me to lift.

ex.chText: 他举手敲门。
ex.enText: He lifted his hand to knock on the door.

synonyms.bx: 指用体力或机械将人或事物举起；也指抬起某一身体部位。

ex.chText: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。
ex.enText: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.

ex.chText: 他们企图把罗兰抬上总统宝座。
ex.enText: They attempted to elevate Roland to the position of president.

synonyms.bx: 指将人或物抬高、举高，也可引申指提高地位或职位。

ex.chText: 水手们早晨升起了旗帜。
ex.enText: The sailors hoisted the flags in the morning.

ex.chText: 他们需要吊起混凝土块。
ex.enText: They need to hoist the concrete blocks.

synonyms.bx: 常指用绳索、起重机等把某物升起。

ex.chText: 他把哑铃从地上举起来。
ex.enText: He raised the dumbbell from the ground.

ex.chText: 我举双手赞成拦河筑坝。
ex.enText: I'll raise both hands in favour of damming the river.

ex.chText: 他抬眼盯视着她。
ex.enText: He raised his eyes and stared at her.

synonyms.bx: 常指用体力将某事物抬高或举高；也指抬起眼睛、头或脸以向上看。

ex.chText: 养育年幼的孩子需要更多的耐心。
ex.enText: More patience is needed to rear young children.

ex.chText: 那里大多数村民都养牛。
ex.enText: Most villagers there rear cattle.

ex.chText: 这些鸟曾经是笼养的。
ex.enText: The birds used to be reared in captivity.

synonyms.bx: 指养育孩子或饲养动物。

ex.chText: 他是由姑姑抚养大的。
ex.enText: He was brought up by his aunt.

ex.chText: 小孩子通常都被教导要听父母的话。
ex.enText: Children are usually brought up to follow parents' advices.

synonyms.bx: 指照顾、教导孩子直到其成年。

ex.chText: 离婚后，她独自抚养3个孩子。
ex.enText: After her divorce, she alone raised her three children.

ex.chText: 他年轻的时候养过羊。
ex.enText: He raised sheep when he was young.

ex.chText: 她计划退休之后种植草莓。
ex.enText: She planned to raise strawberries after retirement.

synonyms.bx: 指抚养孩子长大；也指饲养动物或种植某种植物。

tr: the act of raising something
example: he responded with a lift of his eyebrow
fireman learn several different raises for getting ladders up

tr: increasing the size of a bet (as in poker)
example: I'll see your raise and double it

tr: the amount a salary is increased
an upward slope or grade (as in a road)
example: the car couldn't make it up the rise

tr: cause to become alive again
example: Slavery is already dead, and cannot be resurrected

tr: raise the level or amount of something
increase
put an end to
raise in rank or condition
example: The new law lifted many people from poverty

tr: invigorate or heighten
bring (a surface or a design) into relief and cause to project
multiply (a number) by itself a specified number of times: 8 is 2 raised to the power 3
establish radio communications with
example: They managed to raise Hanoi last night

tr: activate or stir up
cause to be heard or known
express or utter
pronounce (vowels) by bringing the tongue closer to the roof of the mouth
put forward for consideration or discussion
cause to assemble or enlist in the military
bet more than the previous player
bid (one's partner's suit) at a higher level
summon into action or bring into existence, often as if by magic
example: he conjured wild birds in the air
call down the spirits from the mountain

tr: construct, build, or erect
cultivate by growing, often involving improvements by means of agricultural techniques
example: The Bordeaux region produces great red wines
They produce good ham in Parma

tr: create a disturbance, especially by making a great noise
call forth (emotions, feelings, and responses)
move upwards
raise from a lower to a higher position
cause to puff up with a leaven
collect funds for a specific purpose
example: The President raised several million dollars for his college

tr: give a promotion to or assign to a higher position
example: John was kicked upstairs when a replacement was hired
Women tend not to advance in the major law firms
I got promoted after many years of hard work

tr: bring up

value.def: If you raise something, you move it so that it is in a higher position.

example.ex: He raised his hand to wave...
example.tran: 他举手挥动起来。

example.ex: She went to the window and raised the blinds...
example.tran: 她走到窗前，拉起了百叶窗。

example.ex: Milton raised the glass to his lips.
example.tran: 米尔顿把玻璃杯举到唇边。

example.ex: ...a small raised platform.
example.tran: 一个凸起的小平台

value.def: If you raise a flag, you display it by moving it up a pole or into a high place where it can be seen.

example.ex: They had raised the white flag in surrender...
example.tran: 他们举白旗投降了。

example.ex: At midnight, the German flag will be raised over the Reichstag.
example.tran: 半夜时，德国国旗将在德国国会大厦升起。

value.def: If you raise yourself, you lift your body so that you are standing up straight, or so that you are no longer lying flat.

example.ex: He raised himself into a sitting position...
example.tran: 他坐了起来。

example.ex: She raised herself on one elbow.
example.tran: 她用一只胳膊肘撑起身体。

value.def: If you raise the rate or level of something, you increase it.

example.ex: The Republic of Ireland is expected to raise interest rates...
example.tran: 爱尔兰共和国预计会提高利率。

example.ex: Two incidents in recent days have raised the level of concern.
example.tran: 最近发生的两起事件引发了更多人的关注。

example.ex: ...a raised body temperature.
example.tran: 升高的体温

value.def: To raise the standard of something means to improve it.

example.ex: ...a new drive to raise standards of literacy in Britain's schools.
example.tran: 提高英国学校文化水平的新运动

value.def: If you raise your voice, you speak more loudly, usually because you are angry.

example.ex: Don't you raise your voice to me, Henry Rollins!...
example.tran: 别冲我叫嚷，亨利·罗林斯！

example.ex: Anne raised her voice in order to be heard.
example.tran: 为了让人能听得见，安妮提高了嗓门。

value.def: A raise is an increase in your wages or salary.

example.ex: Within two months Kelly got a raise.
example.tran: 不到两个月，凯利就获得了加薪。

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 rise

value.def: If you raise money for a charity or an institution, you ask people for money which you collect on its behalf.

example.ex: ...events held to raise money for Help the Aged...
example.tran: 为“帮助老年人”活动而发起的募捐活动

example.ex: All funds raised will be used by Children With Leukaemia.
example.tran: 所有募集到的资金都将用于“白血病患儿”组织。

value.tran: （为慈善组织、机构等）募捐，筹（款）

value.def: If a person or company raises money that they need, they manage to get it, for example by selling their property or by borrowing.

example.ex: They raised the money to buy the house and two hundred acres of grounds.
example.tran: 他们筹钱来购买房屋及200英亩的土地。

value.def: If an event raises a particular emotion or question, it makes people feel the emotion or consider the question.

example.ex: The agreement has raised hopes that the war may end soon...
example.tran: 那项协议使人们感到战争有望很快结束。

example.ex: The accident again raises questions about the safety of the plant.
example.tran: 这起事故再一次引发了人们对于工厂安全性的质疑。

example.ex: ...a joke that raised a smile on everyone's lips.
example.tran: 让大家都会心一笑的笑话

value.def: If you raise a subject, an objection, or a question, you mention it or bring it to someone's attention.

example.ex: In the meeting Mrs. Ashrawi raised the three main concerns that the Palestinians had...
example.tran: 会议上，阿什拉维夫人提出了巴勒斯坦人最为关注的三个问题。

example.ex: He had been consulted and had raised no objections.
example.tran: 事先征求了他的意见，他并没有提出异议。

value.def: Someone who raises a child looks after it until it is grown up.

example.ex: My mother was an amazing woman. She raised four of us kids virtually singlehandedly.
example.tran: 我的母亲是位了不起的女性。她几乎是一个人把我们4个孩子带大的。

example.ex: ...the house where she was raised.
example.tran: 她在其间长大的那幢房子

value.def: If someone raises a particular type of animal or crop, they breed that type of animal or grow that type of crop.

example.ex: He raises 2,000 acres of wheat and hay.
example.tran: 他种植了2,000英亩的小麦和牧草。

example.ex: ...a perfectly cooked farm-raised chicken.
example.tran: 精心烹制的农场养的鸡

value.boxu_tran: 注意不要混淆raise与rise。raise为及物动词，通常接宾语。rise为不及物动词，不接宾语，而且不可用于被动语态。例如，the government's decision to raise prices（政府上调价格的决定），The number of dead is likely to rise (死亡人数可能会上升）。raise与rise作名词时，都可指薪水的提高。美国英语用raise, 而英国英语用rise。例如，Millions of Americans get a pay raise today（数百万美国人今天获得了加薪），a rise of at least 12 per cent（至少12%的加薪）。
value.boxu_usage: You should be careful not to confuse the verbs raise and rise. Raise is a transitive verb and usually followed by an object, whereas rise is an intransitive verb and not followed by an object. Rise can also not be used in the passive. ...the government's decision to raise prices... The number of dead is likely to rise. Both raise and rise can be used as nouns to mean pay increase. Raise is used in American English, and rise is used in British English. Millions of Americans get a pay raise today. ...a rise of at least 12 per cent.

trans: 那里融来资金；筹集资金；筹集；募款；哪里融来资金

queryExplainVideo.detail: 如何区分 raise 和 rise
